intro: Bellucia costaricensis, commonly known as the Costa Rican bellucia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to Central America, particularly Costa Rica and Panama, where it grows in tropical lowland forests. The plant is a small tree or shrub, typically reaching heights of up to 5 meters, with smooth, grayish bark and opposite, ovate leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered in yellowish-green cyathia, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. Bellucia costaricensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and birds.
